intro: Commelina moluccana, commonly known as the Moluccan spiderwort, is a herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features slender, upright stems and produces small, blue or violet flowers that are often surrounded by white bracts. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth texture. Commelina moluccana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
